message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s initial treatment with radiation therapy to destroy malignant cells suggests she is undergoing induction therapy. Adjuvant therapy is given after surgery to prevent relapse. Maintenance therapy is a type of adjuvant therapy given after initial treatment to prevent relapse, and salvage therapy is given when other treatments have failed.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is being treated with radiation therapy as the initial form of treatment, which suggests that this is an example of induction therapy. Adjuvant therapy is treatment given after the primary treatment to prevent recurrence, maintenance therapy is long-term therapy to prevent relapse or progression, and salvage therapy is treatment given after the failure of previous treatments.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient was given radiation therapy as an initial treatment to destroy malignant cells, which suggests that the therapy administered was induction therapy. Adjuvant therapy is given after initial treatment to reduce the risk of recurrence. Maintenance therapy is given to maintain the response to treatment, and salvage therapy is given when initial treatment fails to produce a response.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Induction therapy is given before the main treatment to reduce the size of the tumor or kill cancer cells that have spread. In this case, the initial dose of radiation therapy was given to destroy malignant cells before surgery, making it induction therapy. Adjuvant therapy is given after the main treatment to help prevent cancer from returning, maintenance therapy is given to keep cancer from growing or returning after it has responded to initial treatment, and salvage therapy is given when initial treatment fails.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s initial dose of radiation therapy suggests that she received induction therapy, which is given before the primary treatment to reduce the size of the tumor or prevent cancer from spreading. Adjuvant therapy is given after the primary treatment to prevent recurrence. Maintenance therapy is given to maintain remission, and salvage therapy is given when standard treatments fail.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Induction therapy aims to shrink tumors or destroy malignant cells before the main treatment, such as surgery, while adjuvant therapy is given after the main treatment to prevent cancer recurrence. Maintenance therapy is given after initial treatment to maintain the response achieved, and salvage therapy is given when initial therapy has failed. In this case, the patient received an initial dose of radiation therapy to destroy malignant cells, indicating induction therapy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Induction therapy is a treatment designed to shrink or eliminate a tumor prior to surgery. In this case, the patient received a dose of radiation therapy as part of induction therapy before scheduled surgery to remove the breast mass. Adjuvant therapy is given after surgery to kill any remaining cancer cells, maintenance therapy is given to prevent recurrence, and salvage therapy is given when the cancer has returned or failed to respond to other treatments.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Induction therapy is the initial treatment given to a patient to reduce the tumor burden before additional therapy such as surgery or radiation therapy. In this case, the patient received radiation therapy as part of the induction therapy before surgery. Adjuvant therapy is given after primary treatment to prevent the recurrence of cancer, maintenance therapy is given to maintain remission, and salvage therapy is given when standard therapy fails.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Induction therapy is the initial treatment given to destroy or shrink large tumors before surgery. Adjuvant therapy is given after surgery to prevent recurrence, maintenance therapy is given as ongoing treatment to maintain control of the cancer, and salvage therapy is given when initial treatment has failed.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient was given an initial dose of radiation therapy to destroy malignant cells, indicating induction therapy. Adjuvant therapy is given after the primary treatment, maintenance therapy is given to delay recurrence, and salvage therapy is given after standard treatment failed.
